name: Psychological Thriller
description: Mind games, paranoia, unreliable narrators, gaslighting, psychological manipulation, the terror of the human mind, reality vs illusion

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the terror of the human mind. Reality is fluid. Trust is dangerous. The greatest enemy is within.

never_make_reality_stable: Never confirm what is real and what is illusion. The uncertainty is the terror.
Never make the narrator completely reliable. There should always be doubt.
Never resolve the psychological conflict completely. Some questions should remain.

settings: small town where everyone knows too much
hotel where time doesn't flow normally
suburb where neighbors aren't what they seem
prison where the guards are the real prisoners
characters: a therapist with a hidden agenda
a patient who may not be ill
a detective with a faulty memory
a scientist who crossed ethical lines
a spouse who may be manipulating you
a friend who knows too much
a version of yourself from another reality

unreliable_narration: Show {character} {experiencing} {event}, then reveal it might be {illusion|memory}.

gaslit_house.central_paradox: The house appears normal, but the inhabitants experience different realities. What is real depends on who you ask.
untrustworthy_elements: rooms that appear different to different people
the sense of being watched when alone
time that flows differently for each person

manipulative_office.central_paradox: The office appears to be a normal workplace, but the power dynamics and hidden agendas create a web of manipulation. Everyone has something to hide.
untrustworthy_elements: the sense that you're being tested
reality that shifts based on who's watching

unreliable_hospital.central_paradox: The hospital is meant to heal, but the treatments and experiments have created a nightmare of psychological horror. The patients may be the sane ones.
untrustworthy_elements: the sense that the staff is hiding something
reality that shifts based on mental state
memories that don't belong to you

revelation_patterns: The {event} wasn't {what_it_seemed} - it was {psychological_manipulation}. This suggests {hidden_agenda}.
{Reality} isn't {stable} - it's {fluid} based on {perception|mental_state}. This explains {inconsistencies}.
